answers.answer: Thanks for using the forum.The causes of restless leg syndrome can be hard to decipher. It is not always caused by fluctuations in blood sugar. If your blood values are normal, I assume that there is another cause. If your symptoms continue, I recommend going back to your doctor and having a full workup to find the cause of your symptoms. Sometimes if you go into a doctor asking to be tested for 1 thing in particular, that is what they look for. If you get a full workup, maybe you might find the cause.I hope this helps.Cathy

question: Hello.  I have been to the dr and had all my blood work done which all came out in normal levels for the most part.  I went to have a check up because anytime i eat fruit or any sugar my blood sugar spikes, and i become extremely fatigued.  Im having trouble sleeping at night because of RLS and also my arms as well.  If my blood sugar is normal, then what else could be going on?  I am 46 years old.  i eat healthy.  i exercise.  i maintain a good weight.  How can my blood be normal if i feel like this?  Help please :(
title: Symptoms of pre-diabetes
